keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: A former commander of the Lord’s Resistance Army was accused of using rape and brutality to turn children abducted by the rebels into sex slaves or soldiers.

headline.print_headline: Europe; The Hague: Prosecutors Seek to Try a Ugandan Rebel
headline.main: The Hague: Prosecutors Seek to Try a Ugandan Rebel

snippet: A former commander of the Lord’s Resistance Army was accused of using rape and brutality to turn children abducted by the rebels into sex slaves or soldiers.
abstract: Prosecutors at International Criminal Court hearing in The Hague accuse Dominic Ongwen, commander of Ugandan military group called Lord’s Resistance Army, of 70 counts of war crimes and crimes against humanity.
